duck: "Candidate" (David Bowie song) - "Candidate" is a song written by David Bowie in 1973 and intended for his never-completed musical version of Nineteen Eighty-Four.
candidate definition: one that aspires to or is nominated or qualified for an office, membership, or award.
The Candidate (1964 film) by Robert Angus, aka Party Girls for the Candidate, aka The Playmates and the Candidate
A candidate is a person or thing seeking or being considered for some kind of position:
The Candidate (TV) an Afghan TV series supported by the CEPPS agreement
"The Candidate" (Lost), an episode of the sixth and final season of the television drama Lost
The Candidate (1980 film) by Stefan Aust, Alexander Kluge, Volker Schlöndorff, Alexander von Eschwege, German title: Der Kandidat
The Candidate (1997 film) by Skafti Gudmundsson and Ólafur Rögnvaldsson
Candidates Tournament, a qualification event for the World Chess Championship
The Candidate (1972 film) by Michael Ritchie, with Robert Redford
The Candidate (2008 film) by Kasper Barfoed, Danish title: Kandidaten
The Candidate (album) an album by Steve Harley

wiki.text:
A 'candidate', or 'nominee', is the prospective recipient of an award or honor,
or a person seeking or being considered for some kind of position; for example:
* to be elected to an office — in this case a candidate selection
  procedure occurs.
* to receive membership in a group

"Nomination" is part of the process of selecting a candidate for either election
to an office by a political party,<ref name=Definition>Judicial and Statutory
Definitions of Words and Phrases, Volume 1, Edition 2, West Publishing Company,
1914, [http://books.google.com/books?id=NGU8AAAAIAAJ&pg=PA558&dq=nominee+candid-
ate+definitions+of+words&hl=en&sa=X&ei=U_enT8qBPOO16AGr3e2ZBA&ved=0CEoQ6AEwAA#v-
=onepage&q=nominee%20candidate%20definitions%20of%20words&f=false p. 588] [http-
://books.google.com/books?id=MXE8AAAAIAAJ&pg=PA618&dq=nominee+candidate+definit-
ions&hl=en&sa=X&ei=-
venT57fF6mX6QHylqGoBA&ved=0CD0Q6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=nominee%20candidate%20definit-
ions&f=false p. 618]</ref> or the bestowing of an honor or award. This person is
called a "nominee,"<ref></ref> though nominee often is used interchangeably with
"candidate." "Presumptive nominee" is a term used when a person or organization
believes that the nomination is inevitable. The act of being a candidate in a
race for either a party nomination or for electoral office is called a
"candidacy."<ref></ref>

"Candidate" is a derivative of the Latin "candida" (white).<ref></ref> In
Ancient Rome, people running for political office would usually wear togas
chalked and bleached to be bright white at speeches, debates, conventions, and
other public functions.<ref></ref>
wiki.title: candidate
